definition: fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
5th earthly branch: 7-9 a.m., 3rd solar month (5th April-4th May), year of the Dragon/ancient Chinese compass point: 120°
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself

sentences.english: A special wish for my friend . May the beauty of the season bring joy to your heart.
sentences.chinese: 衷心祝愿我的朋友，愿这良辰美景带给你内心的欢乐。

sentences.english: Nor is the city withoutits moments of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 城市也并非没有良辰美景。

sentences.english: Thanks these beautiful scenery on a beautiful day, forever is being moist my eye.
sentences.chinese: 谢谢那些良辰美景，永远湿润着我眼睛。

sentences.english: Nor is the city without its moments of beauty.
sentences.chinese: 城市也并非没有自己的良辰美景。

sentences.english: Begonia opened, the swallows, the scenery all day nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 海棠开后，燕子来时，良辰美景奈何天。

sentences.english: I invited her to enjoy the beautiful scene on a bright day.
sentences.chinese: 我邀请她共度这个良辰美景。

definition: see 月下花前[yue4 xia4 hua1 qian2]
lit. lovely flowers, round moon (idiom); fig. everything is wonderful/perfect happiness/conjugal bliss
from dawn to dusk/all the time
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
refined and elegant attitude of mind
scenes of springtime/the radiance of spring/(fig.) a sight of sth sexy or erotic/an indication of a love affair
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
